result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

12:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan Thomas Kreger appeared by video.  Attorney Philip J. Brehm in court for Ryan Thomas Kreger. Court denies Defense motion to modify bond. Court modifies bond to allow defendant to have contact through third party for child care purposes only. Matter to be set.

records.addlTxt: Bail/bond hearing on July 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on July 5, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Phil Brehm

Activity: Status conference 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

2:37 PM Defendant Ryan Thomas Kreger in court by video with attorney Philip J. Brehm by video.  Cheniqua White appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Victim M.K appeared in court by video. Kim Rau appeared in court in person for Victim Witness. Court finds the defendant indigent and appoints attorney Philip Brehm. Defendant to reimburse the County according to payment plan already in place in other criminal matters. Court denies Defense motion to modify bond.  Status conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 11:15 am.
MK
Initial Scheduling Order
Status conference on June 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Activity:  Preliminary hearing and arraingment  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:51 AM Defendant Ryan Thomas Kreger in court by audio with attorney Philip J. Brehm by video.  Cheniqua White appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Jessica Baker appeared by video. Victim M.K. appeared by video. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily. Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Defense argues for bond modification. State objects with argument. Court denies modification.
Waiver of No Contact Provision of Bond - MK
Attorney Brehm's request to be appointed
Preliminary hearing on May 31, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Activity:  Initial appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:39 PM Defendant Ryan Thomas Kreger in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Philip J. Brehm by video.  David S Olson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address and date of birth verified. Court orders $1000 Cash bond with conditions:  No contact directly or indirectly with victims P.H., B.C. or E.W., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No contact directly or indirectly with victim M.K, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere EXCEPT by electronic device for child care. Not to operate motor vehicle. Preliminary Hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 10:45 AM.
